meanings.definition: Too small to be seen with a standard microscope.
meanings.sent1: The submicroscopic particles were invisible even under the most powerful microscope.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the submicroscopic organisms using advanced technology.
meanings.sent3: The submicroscopic dust particles played hide and seek with the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so submicroscopic that she noticed the tiniest imperfections.
meanings.sent5: The submicroscopic world is full of mysteries waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: Existing on a scale smaller than microscopic.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a submicroscopic sculpture that required a magnifying glass to appreciate.
meanings.sent2: The submicroscopic details in the painting added depth and complexity to the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The submicroscopic insects in the garden had a secret society of their own.
meanings.sent4: His submicroscopic knowledge of the subject impressed even the experts.
meanings.sent5: The submicroscopic universe within a single cell is a marvel of nature.
